page.title: 16SECONDARY EDUCATION
page.content: THURSTABLE COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL The land for the school was purchased before 1939 but it was not built until 1957.It was called a Secondary Modern School and served a wide area.In 1966 Essex Education Authority approved plans to turn the school into a Comprehensive, although this was not done until 1975. The school has been added to over the years and now boasts such facilities as music and drama studios,large sports' halls, science and technical blocks and multi_purpose halls.At the present time it caters for about 1,000 children. Its name is derived from an old Essex County division called "Hundreds",Thurstable being the local one.
